meanings.definition: To deposit eggs by means of an ovipositor.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly was ovipositing eggs on the leaf.
meanings.sent2: The bird was ovipositing its eggs in the nest.
meanings.sent3: The ant queen was ovipositing so many eggs, it looked like a tiny egg factory!
meanings.sent4: The farmer was ovipositing seeds in the soil, hoping for a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent5: The fish was ovipositing its eggs in the shallow water, protecting them from predators.

meanings.definition: The act of laying eggs using an ovipositor.
meanings.sent1: The ovipositing of the spider was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the ovipositing of insects for her research.
meanings.sent3: The ovipositing of the chicken made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The ovipositing of the frog reminded me of a tiny egg-laying machine.
meanings.sent5: The ovipositing of the turtle was a slow and deliberate process.
